# Multiple ggplots with patchwork

The package [patchwork](https://patchwork.data-imaginist.com/) (@patchwork) makes combining ggplots possible.

Example from [here](https://patchwork.data-imaginist.com/articles/patchwork.html).

```{r from-patchwork}
library(ggplot2)
p1 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_point(aes(mpg, disp)) + 
  ggtitle('Plot 1')

p2 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_boxplot(aes(gear, disp, group = gear)) + 
  ggtitle('Plot 2')

p3 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_point(aes(hp, wt, colour = mpg)) + 
  ggtitle('Plot 3')

p4 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_bar(aes(gear)) + 
  facet_wrap(~cyl) + 
  ggtitle('Plot 4')

library(patchwork)
```

Plots next to each other

```{r from-patchwork-next}
p1 + p2
```

Plots under each other

```{r from-patchwork-under}
p1 /p2
```

All at once

```{r from-patchwork-all}
p1 + p2 + p3 + p4
```
